channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: Plastic pipes are polluting drinking water systems after wildfires
item.description: And it’s a risk in urban fires, too.

item.title: 2020 had its share of memorable hacks and breaches. Here are the top 10
item.description: The past 12 months teaches us that, yes, attacks do only get better.

item.title: Grubhub gig workers react angrily to change in tipping policy
item.description: Default tip amount slashed following introduction of California’s new employment rules.

item.title: Dark Archives: Come for the floating goat balls, stay for the fascinating science
item.description: Explore the macabre history of “anthropodermic bibliopegy”: books bound in human skin

item.title: Divers recover a WWII Enigma Machine from the Baltic Sea
item.description: Divers trying to clean fishing nets come up with a bit of history.

item.title: The best cars, SUVs, and crossovers we drove in 2020
item.description: The Civic Type-R brought the most smiles and a pair of hybrid SUVs surprised me.

item.title: Rising to meet the tide against the threat of coastal flooding
item.description: Faster and more accurate forecasts can save lives and property.

item.title: Scientists ID potential biomarkers to peg time of death for submerged corpses
item.description: The levels of certain proteins in bones can reveal how long a body has been in water.

item.title: “Rudderless” QAnon may reinvent itself after US election, warn experts
item.description: Trump’s defeat hurts movement, but influencers continue to hype conspiracy theory.

item.title: Parthenogenesis: How females from some species can reproduce without males
item.description: Some species experience spontaneous parthenogenesis, best documented in zoo settings.

item.title: Want to really understand how bitcoin works? Here’s a gentle primer
item.description: Ars goes deep on the breakthrough online payment network.

item.title: Best new board game apps of 2020
item.description: The best board gaming action… on your phone or computer.

item.title: TV Technica 2020: Our favorite shows and binges in a year of living distantly
item.description: With most major movie releases sidelined until 2021, TV stepped in to fill the gap.

item.title: Wonder Woman 1984 is fun, but doesn’t quite capture magic of its predecessor
item.description: Patty Jenkins' sequel is hampered by nonsensical plot, heavy-handed moralizing

item.title: Study: children’s belief in Santa Claus is more nuanced than you think
item.description: Santa falls into an ambiguous category between “real” and “nonreal” for many children

item.title: 2020’s 20 most-commented stories
item.description: Yesterday we brought you the most popular stories of 2020. These are the most talked-about.

item.title: Nikola stock craters after cancellation of major garbage truck order
item.description: Nikola has been on the defensive since fraud allegations surfaced in September.

item.title: Poignant The Midnight Sky wrestles with whether humankind is worth saving
item.description: George Clooney directed and stars in adaptation of the Lily Brooks-Dalton novel

item.title: 2020’s 20 most-read stories on Ars Technica
item.description: It’s our annual rundown of the most-read stories.

item.title: Google develops an AI that can learn both chess and Pac-Man
item.description: MuZero handles both rules-based and open-ended games.

item.title: Trump vetoes $740B defense bill, citing “failure to terminate” Section 230
item.description: Congress already scheduled veto override votes for after Christmas.

item.title: Microsoft Flight Simulator in VR: A turbulent start for wide-open skies
item.description: Basic impressions of what to expect—and hopes for patches to come.

item.title: Trump admin. agrees to pay Pfizer $1.95B for 100M more vaccine doses
item.description: Agreement means Pfizer will provide a total of 200M doses, with option for 400M more.

item.title: Musk says Apple passed on Tesla acquisition three years ago
item.description: Tesla got near bankruptcy as it ramped up Model 3 production in 2017 and 2018.

item.title: Samsung’s Galaxy S21 Ultra hits the FCC, confirms S-Pen and Wi-Fi 6E support
item.description: The phone is due out earlier than ever, in mid-January.

item.title: For Biden administration, Fauci’s in, but Birx is not
item.description: Birx was widely seen as too accommodating to Trump but got sidelined anyway.
